item.title: `Math.max` and `Math.min` accept more than two arguments
In JavaScript, a plus symbol (`+`) in front of a variable casts it to a number
item.description: For example, +"1" returns 1. If the value can’t be converted to number type, it will return NaN. For example , +"a" or +{} return NaN.

item.title: You can add CSS to console logs
item.description: By adding c% at the beginning of the string, and a second string argument with CSS rules. Example: console.log('%cmessage', 'color: green;line-height:40px') https://coderwall.

item.title: You can set CSS variables with JavaScript
item.description: JavaScript: DOMElement.style.setProperty('--primary-color', 'yellow') CSS: .my-element { background-color: var(--primary-color); } An article with more information: https://medium.com/@_bengarrison/accessing-and-modifying-css-variables-with-javascript-2ccb735bbff0

item.title: `toLocaleString` formats numbers according to a given locale
item.description: For example, this: (3500).toLocaleString() will return 3,500 if using the US English locale. https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number/toLocaleString
